sen.j: 智通（ちつう、生没年不詳）は、飛鳥時代の法相宗の僧。
sen.e: Chitsu (DOB unknown) was a Hosso sect monk during the Asuka period.
Chitsu (years of birth and death unknown) was a priest of Hosso sect of Buddhism (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang sect or Dharma-character school), who lived in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 形式・用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Chitsu (years of birth and death unknown) was a priest of Hosso sect of Buddhism (Japanese equivalent of the Chinese Faxiang sect or Dharma-character school), who lived in the Asuka period.
His lay clan name was Yue.

sen.j: 658年（斉明天皇4年）智達とともに新羅の船で唐に渡り、玄奘から無性衆生義を受けた。
sen.e: In 658 together with the monk Chitatsu he traveled to T`ang China aboard a boat from Shilla (ancient Korea).

In 658, together with Chitatsu he traveled to Tang China aboard a boat from Shilla (ancient Korea), receiving musho-shujo-gi (literally, musho means 'no self-nature,' shujo 'sentient beings,' and gi 'doctrine or system') by Xuanzang.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現・用語を修正しました。訳漏れ箇所を加筆しました。
sen.e: In 658, together with Chitatsu he traveled to Tang China aboard a boat from Shilla (ancient Korea), receiving musho-shujo-gi (literally, musho means 'no self-nature,' shujo 'sentient beings,' and gi 'doctrine or system') by Xuanzang.

sen.j: 日本に帰国して法相宗を伝え、日本における法相宗の第2伝とされている。
sen.e: Upon his return to Japan he propagated Hosso sect Buddhism becoming the second monk to spread Hosso sect Buddhism in Japan.
Upon his return to Japan Chitsu propagated the Hosso-sect Buddhism, which was supposedly the second transmission of the Hosso-sect Buddhism in Japan.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Upon his return to Japan Chitsu propagated the Hosso-sect Buddhism, which was supposedly the second transmission of the Hosso-sect Buddhism in Japan.

sen.j: 平城京に観音寺を建立し、673年（天武天皇2年）に僧正に任じられた。
sen.e: He built Kannon-ji temple in Heijo (the ancient capital of Nara) and was given the Buddhist monk rank of `Sojo` (top rank) in 673.
He built Kannon-ji Temple in Heijo-kyo Capital (an ancient capital of Japan in Nara) and was given the Buddhist monk rank of Sojo (the top rank) in 673.
